maml:description.maml:para: Initialize unit test
Enter-Test initializes unit test Must be called before first test case in single unit test and in pair with Exit-Test
Optionally specify the command which is to be tested. This value is used by Start-Test function by default which is shown in formatted output unless overridden with Start-Test.
Should be specified to test private module functions
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Optionally specify the command which is to be tested. This value is used by Start-Test function by default which is shown in formatted output unless overridden with Start-Test.
Should be specified to test private module functions
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Enter-Test
None. Enter-Test does not generate any output

maml:alert.maml:para: HACK: Using -Private switch will not work as expected if private function depends on or calls other module variables or public module functions, see Edit-Table for example

maml:description.maml:para: Un-initialize and exit unit test
Exit-Test performs finishing steps after unit test is done, ie. to restore previous state Must be called in pair with Enter-Test and after all test cases are done in single unit test
Should be specified to exit test that was entered with Enter-Test -Private
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Should be specified to exit test that was entered with Enter-Test -Private
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Exit-Test

maml:alert.maml:para: TODO: Write-Information instead of Write-Output, but problem is that is may be logged

maml:description.maml:para: Print new unit test section
New-Section prints new section to group multiple test cases. Useful for unit test with a lof of test cases, for readability.
Section title
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Section title
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to New-Section

maml:description.maml:para: Remove all items from test drive

Test drive is directory where unit tests may output their temporary data. This function clears test directory leaving only test drive root directory. If the test drive does not exist new one is created. For safety reasons, when non default test drive is specified the function will complete operation only if run as standard user, in which case it prompts for confirmation.
Test drive location. The default is "TestDrive" directory inside well known test directory in repository.
Specify the number of times this function will repeat an attempt to clear test drive. This is needed in cases such as when contents are in use by another process. The default is 2.
The timeout interval (in milliseconds) between each retry attempt. The default is 1 second.
Skip prompting clearing non default test drive. This parameter has no effect if the function is run as Administrator.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Test drive location. The default is "TestDrive" directory inside well known test directory in repository.

The timeout interval (in milliseconds) between each retry attempt. The default is 1 second.
Skip prompting clearing non default test drive. This parameter has no effect if the function is run as Administrator.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Reset-TestDrive
None. Reset-TestDrive does not generate any output

maml:description.maml:para: Stop test case
Restore-Test writes output to console after test case is done This function must be called after single test case is done executing
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Restore-Test
None. Restore-Test does not generate any output

maml:description.maml:para: Start test case
Start-Test writes formatted header block the console for separate test cases. This function should be called before single test case starts executing.
Message to format and print before test case begins. This message is appended to command being tested and then printed.
Expected output of a test. This value is appended to Message.
The command which is to be tested, it's inserted into message. This value overrides default Command parameter specified in Enter-Test.

Used to test, test cases expected to fail. When specified a global "TestEV" error variable is created and reused by Restore-Test, errors generated for test case are silenced and converted to informational message. However this works only for global functions, see example below for a workaround.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Message to format and print before test case begins. This message is appended to command being tested and then printed.
Expected output of a test. This value is appended to Message.
The command which is to be tested, it's inserted into message. This value overrides default Command parameter specified in Enter-Test.

Used to test, test cases expected to fail. When specified a global "TestEV" error variable is created and reused by Restore-Test, errors generated for test case are silenced and converted to informational message. However this works only for global functions, see example below for a workaround.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Start-Test

maml:alert.maml:para: TODO: Switch for no new line, some tests will produce redundant new lines, ex. Format-Table on pipeline TODO: Doesn't work for starting tests inside dynamic modules TODO: Write-Information instead of Write-Output

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Start-Test "some test" -Force PS> Function-WhichFails -ErrorVariable TestEV -EA SilentlyContinue PS> Restore-Test

dev:remarks.maml:para: Error is converted to informational message with Restore-Test. Here TestEV is a global error variable made with -Force switch, -EA SilentlyContinue must be specified only for module functions.

maml:description.maml:para: Test links in markdown files

Test each link in one or multiple markdown files and report if any link is invalid. You can "brute force" test links or test only unique ones. Links to be tested can be excluded or included by using wildcard pattern. Test can be customized for various TLS protocols, query timeouts and retry attempts. The links to be tested can be reference links, inline links or both.
Specifies a path to one or more locations containing target markdown files. Wildcard characters are supported.
If specified, recurse in to the path specified by Path parameter

Specifies (per link) how long the request can be pending before it times out. A value, 0, specifies an indefinite time-out. A Domain Name System (DNS) query can take up to 15 seconds to return or time out.

If your request contains a host name that requires resolution, and you set TimeoutSec to a value greater than zero, but less than 15 seconds, it can take 15 seconds or more before the request times out. The default value is 20 seconds.

Specifies (per link) how many times PowerShell retries a connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received. This parameter is valid for PowerShell Core edition only. The default value is defined in $PSSessionOption preference variable

Specifies the interval between retries for the connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received This parameter is valid for PowerShell Core edition only. The default value is 3 seconds

Specifies how many times PowerShell redirects a connection to an alternate Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) before the connection fails. A value of 0 (zero) prevents all redirection. The default value is 5
Sets the SSL/TLS protocols that are permissible for the web request. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0 and support for Tls13 was added in PowerShell 7.1.
Indicates the test shouldn't use a proxy to reach the destination. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0.
Specifies an URL wildcard pattern that this function includes in the operation.
Specifies an URL wildcard pattern that this function excludes from operation.
Specifies the type of links to check, acceptable values are:
-Inline ex. \ label\ (URL)-Reference ex. [label]: URL -Any process both inline and reference links
If specified, only unique links are tested reducing the amount of time needed for bulk link test operation

The Depth parameter determines the number of subdirectory levels that are included in the recursion. For example, Depth 2 includes the Path parameter's directory, first level of subdirectories, and second level of subdirectories.
If specified, invalid links are logged. Log file can be found in Logs\MarkdownLinkTest_DATE.log
Specifies a path to one or more locations containing target markdown files. The value of LiteralPath is used exactly as it's typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards.
If specified, recurse in to the path specified by Path parameter

Specifies (per link) how long the request can be pending before it times out. A value, 0, specifies an indefinite time-out. A Domain Name System (DNS) query can take up to 15 seconds to return or time out.

If your request contains a host name that requires resolution, and you set TimeoutSec to a value greater than zero, but less than 15 seconds, it can take 15 seconds or more before the request times out. The default value is 20 seconds.

Specifies (per link) how many times PowerShell retries a connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received. This parameter is valid for PowerShell Core edition only. The default value is defined in $PSSessionOption preference variable

Specifies the interval between retries for the connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received This parameter is valid for PowerShell Core edition only. The default value is 3 seconds

Specifies how many times PowerShell redirects a connection to an alternate Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) before the connection fails. A value of 0 (zero) prevents all redirection. The default value is 5
Sets the SSL/TLS protocols that are permissible for the web request. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0 and support for Tls13 was added in PowerShell 7.1.
Indicates the test shouldn't use a proxy to reach the destination. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0.
Specifies an URL wildcard pattern that this function includes in the operation.
Specifies an URL wildcard pattern that this function excludes from operation.
Specifies the type of links to check, acceptable values are:
-Inline ex. \ label\ (URL)-Reference ex. [label]: URL -Any process both inline and reference links
If specified, only unique links are tested reducing the amount of time needed for bulk link test operation

The Depth parameter determines the number of subdirectory levels that are included in the recursion. For example, Depth 2 includes the Path parameter's directory, first level of subdirectories, and second level of subdirectories.
If specified, invalid links are logged. Log file can be found in Logs\MarkdownLinkTest_DATE.log
Specifies a path to one or more locations containing target markdown files. Wildcard characters are supported.
Specifies a path to one or more locations containing target markdown files. The value of LiteralPath is used exactly as it's typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards.
If specified, recurse in to the path specified by Path parameter

Specifies (per link) how long the request can be pending before it times out. A value, 0, specifies an indefinite time-out. A Domain Name System (DNS) query can take up to 15 seconds to return or time out.

If your request contains a host name that requires resolution, and you set TimeoutSec to a value greater than zero, but less than 15 seconds, it can take 15 seconds or more before the request times out. The default value is 20 seconds.

Specifies (per link) how many times PowerShell retries a connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received. This parameter is valid for PowerShell Core edition only. The default value is defined in $PSSessionOption preference variable

Specifies the interval between retries for the connection when a failure code between 400 and 599, inclusive or 304 is received This parameter is valid for PowerShell Core edition only. The default value is 3 seconds

Specifies how many times PowerShell redirects a connection to an alternate Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) before the connection fails. A value of 0 (zero) prevents all redirection. The default value is 5
Sets the SSL/TLS protocols that are permissible for the web request. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0 and support for Tls13 was added in PowerShell 7.1.
Indicates the test shouldn't use a proxy to reach the destination. This feature was added in PowerShell 6.0.0.

Specifies the type of links to check, acceptable values are:
-Inline ex. \ label\ (URL)-Reference ex. [label]: URL -Any process both inline and reference links
If specified, only unique links are tested reducing the amount of time needed for bulk link test operation

The Depth parameter determines the number of subdirectory levels that are included in the recursion. For example, Depth 2 includes the Path parameter's directory, first level of subdirectories, and second level of subdirectories.
